intro: Plagiobothrys chrysocephalus, commonly known as the goldenhead bluecurls, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has hairy, slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and slopes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
